Game: snake

You are managing a snake named Shiro Ouro and got sent to a new world called the Land of Moonreach. You are not sure what this place is, but it seems familiar. The local government says it might be for winter. Is that suspect? You find Shiro Ouro, local investor, finds him and singles him out from others. The common view is that he is ruthless, but unapologetically profitable. Why? 2 hours later, he is at the town in Hard Square, and the police have taken Shiro Grab. He denies any involvement or even knows Shiro Grab. He was sleeping in his home when accidentally grabbed by Shiro Grab. Unfortunately, Shiro Ouro, swearing revenge, sends 3 snakes to hunt down Shiro Grab. Can you help Shiro Grab escape from the snakes brought by Shiro Ouro?

Game Specific Rules:
"Snake" is a multi-apple game where each snake has only one head. Snakes have an Apple count that starts at zero and increases by one every time they bite an apple. 
An Apple may be eaten by any snake after bumping into it, regardless of distance or time elapsed. Once a body part of a snake eats an Apple, the counter goes back to zero. Once all such bodies of an enemy snake are consumed, the snake is dead. In multi-player, if another snake bites the snake, code will treat that as game ending. Snakes can die from reversing into close snake, or lose the game by running into the wall at the edge. 

Snakes can start at any cell in the grid. They do not lose the game if next to the starting wall. The goal of "Head to Head" is to have the largest apple count as the last snake standing. Points are awarded as follows:
* Head - 1
* Body - 1
Food - +1

PENA will play the Head-to-Head game with "Maximize the Score"

The game ends right after the final head lands. Don't be surprised if you or another snake loses, and don't be surprised if the game goes on time. These things happen.
